intro.text:
You must be the new student! It is so great to finally meet you!
[color=green](Press space to continue)[/color]

intro 2.text: The name is [wave amp=50 freq=1.5]Pompom[/wave]. Your tour guide and campus mascot

intro 3.text: I am sure you have some questions.

intro 3.1.text: [i]why is the cat talking?[/i] and stuff like that

intro 3.1.1.text: [color=green]When you have a choice of what to say, you will hear a sound and the choices will appear[/color]

intro 4.text:
Simply raise your hand and ask away!
[color=green]Any time you have a choice, use the arrow keys to select your answer, and press enter to confirm[/color]

choices.text: I thought you were a different animal.
choices.label: intro 4.1

intro 4.1.text: [wave amp=50 freq=1.5]Who knows~[/wave] I've been called many things but rest assured, I am a talking cat right now.

intro 5.text: Ha! knew it! Maybe for another time.

intro 5.01.text: Oh! It looks like you just earned some points!

intro 5.02.text:
When you earn a point it will look like this:
[color=green]+1 Fake Point[/color]

intro 5.03.text:
Points can help you earn [wave amp=50 freq=1.5] stars. [/wave]
You can see your stars in the top right of your screen

intro 5.04.text: What are stars you ask? Good question!

intro 5.05.text: The full term for them are wish stars and are a speciality local to this university, and they do some fun stuff when you get a hold of a couple! So try and get as many as you can

intro 5.06.text: You can earn points to fill your stars by talking to your instructor and learning new things! They're usually split up as star fragments.

intro 5.2.text: I'd like to ask you a few questions to better understand you

intro 5.3.text: Just answer on a number scale with 1 as meaning "Not all that true for me", 7 being "Very true of me", and 4 being the middle ground of "Somewhat true of me"

intro 5.4.text: [i]I'm confident I can understand the most complex material presented by my instructors in post-secondary[/i]

intro 5.5.text: [i]I'm confident I can do an excellent job on the assignments and tests in post-secondary[/i]

intro 9.text: My head was not gifted with a walking animation.

intro 9.2.text: I will not be doing that for every action I do.

intro 11.text: Here in this virtual campus , You will be taught the necessary preparations for attending a post secondary institute

intro 12.text: In this particular tour with me, we will be covering...

intro 13.text: The concept of Loops, Mindsets, and a short summary of some of modules you will be learning after this one.

intro 14.text: Feel free to tell me which one do you want to start on first

Something else.text: Sure! What else do you wanna talk about?

Loops 1.text: Being a cat has its benefits of being able to observe all kinds of students throughout the campus...

Loops 2.text: Mostly through the windows since animals are not allowed inside of facilities.

Loops 3.text: And out of concern for those with cat allergies.

Loops 4.text: May I ask you a quick survey question?

Loops 4.1.text: [b]If I don't understand my course material, it is because I didn't try hard enough.[/b]

Loops 5.text: Some professors give tasks to students...

Loops 6.text: ...some these tasks are often seen as "challenges" by the students.

Loops 7.text: And how these students go about said tasks will end up going in one of two [i]Loops[/i]

Loops 8.text: Perhaps we should try and picture a scenario to best learn about these loops...

Loops 9.text: [color=blue]Pompom goes to a nearby ledge and sets up some pen, paper, an iPod[/color]

Loops 11.text: Your professor looks at your class with great pride after a hard day's lecture.

Loops 12.text: The students' voices echo around you as dismissal conversations begin. The noises collapsing onto fixed points as peers gathered at the halls.

Loops 13.text: You're the only one left in the room. Your professor approaches you and says your name!

Want 3.text:
Just grab a rock or something
[color=green]You pick up an odd 20 sided rock[/color]

Want 6.text: Your professor said that it is time for you to submit your essay topic. You are the only one who has not submitted yet.

Worst 2.text: Your professor showed visible confusion and disgust to the very topic you just proposed. They accept anyways out of the pure pressure of the "Let's just get this over with" mindset

Worst 3.text:
"No way you could make this topic work! This better be some paper." They demanded.
[color=green]-100 misfortune[/color]

Best 3.text:
"Wow! Now that is something that could go on the news! Might even win you a Nobel Prize or something! I look forward to this." The Professor says.
[color=green]+250 Luck[/color]

Mid 2.text: You talk about your topic to your professor with as much detail as possible.

Mid 3.text: The professor acknowledges and nods their head in contempt with your topic.

Mid 4.text: "I accept your topic! I look forward to reading your paper." They said

Essay 1.text: You head home and open up your laptop to begin writing your essay.

Essay 2.text: The writing software opens and you type your first words...

Mid Essay 2.text: You write your essay for a couple of hours...

Mid Essay 4.text: The essay came out just fine! And you passed the assignment!

Mid Essay 5.text:
You got a B+ on your paper the following week.
[color=green]+80 grades[/color]

Mid Essay 6.text: Your professor asks you whether you would like another assignment for extra credit. Do you take this chance?

Worst Essay 1.1.text: You sit down and watch your screen...

Worst Essay 2.text: ...you sit down and continue to watch your screen...

Worst Essay 3.text: You sit down and continue to realize that you have had writer's block for the past 2 hours prior to midnight.

Worst Essay 4.text: You know you need to make this paper by morning so you soldier on and eventually finish your paper.

Worst Essay 5.text: You pass your paper to your professor. You almost fell asleep on your way back to your table.

Worst Essay 6.text:
The professor approaches you the following week with your paper graded. You got a C-
[color=green]+10 grades[/color]

Worst Essay 7.text: Your professor understood that you had quite a struggle writing the paper and presents to you the opportunity to replace your current grade with a new paper. Do you take this chance?

Best Essay 2.text: You psych yourself up as you spread your fingers across the keyboard with confidence.

Best Essay 3.text: You begin writing at rapid speeds and you know EXACTLY what you're talking about in this paper

Best Essay 4.text: You finish the essay without a hitch and you pass it off to your professor.

Best Essay 5.text:
"Player, this is the best darn paper I have ever read! You get an A+!" The professor said calmly.
[color=green]+200 grades[/color]

Best Essay 6.text: They would actually like for you to write another paper for a research summit next Summer! Do you take the challenge?

Struggle Loop 1.text: Let's leave this short campaign on a cliff hanger for now

{F}yes.text: That was some determination to improve you showed taking up a second chance like that!

{F}no.text: You not taking the second chance was a perfectly reasonable response. Writing is hard!

Struggle Loop 3.text: The struggle you felt while performing the task within the short campaign was actually an example of how one would go through a "struggle loop"

Struggle Loop 4.text: Tasks are often performed with some bit of struggle, hence the name

Struggle Loop 5.text: And going through this loop, some individuals often label themselves as [b]dumb[/b],[b]lazy[/b], or a [wave amp=50 freq=1.5][b]failure[/wave][/b]

Struggle Loop 6.text: Which I am telling you right now!

Struggle Loop 8.text: Don't be too hard on yourself when this stuff happens.

Struggle Loop 9.text: Nothing improves and labeling won't help that.

Struggle Loop 10.text: The struggle loop also involves avoiding challenging tasks that will make us label ourselves more

Struggle Loop 11.text: This process rinses and repeats and therefore it becomes this struggle loop.

Success Loop 1.text: Let's leave this short campaign on a cliff hanger for now

{F}yes.text: I'm glad to know that you would have taken a second challenge after the first one!

{F}no.text: It was quite understandable that writing a second paper after the first one is tough and that you need to rest.

Success Loop 3.text: Big and small victories like earning a passing grade in your essay are what starts up one of the two loops known as the [wave amp=150 freq=1.5][b]success loop[/wave][/b]

Success Loop 4.text: In the success loop, motivations are at an all time high due to the recent "successes"

Success Loop 5.text: This often leads to someone performing even more tasks to succeed in. Boosting self-esteem in the process!

Success Loop 6.text: However, the bad part about this is that the loop only goes on for as long as one's success does.

Success Loop 7.text: Meaning one hint of failure could end up erasing all the previous motivation and momentum one had attained

not {F}success.text: The opposite of this would be the success loop.

not {F}struggle.text: The opposite of this would be the struggle loop.

not {F}success.text: Where more tasks are being done and confidence and self-esteem are at an all time high!

not {F}struggle.text: It is a loop where the smallest bits of struggle is seen as a challenge that could ruin one's self-esteem.

not {F}success.text: More often than not, those that are experience a success loop stop doing their task on the first failure. Losing motivation in the end.

not {F}struggle.text: Those experiencing a struggle loop end up avoiding challenging tasks all together to avoid calling themselve's a failure. Which is not true and can be improved!

Cond Loops 4.text: Not one loop is exclusively for one person to get into and not exactly one is better than the other either.

Cond Loops 5.text: We all fall under one of the two but success usually comes from a healthy mindset towards the approach to the task.

Cond Loops 6.text: And understanding these loops are what brings us a step closer to improving our mindsets. (YOU OBTAINED THE LOOPS KEYWORD)

Mindsets 4.2.text: The concept of the "Mindsets" refers to how people thinks about their own talents and abilities.

Mindsets 2.text: [i]If I try hard enough, then I will understand course material.[/i]

Mindsets 2.1.text: [i]It is my own fault if I don't learn the material in my courses[/i]

Mindsets 5.text: People can have a "fixed" mindset, or a "growth" mindet, or somewhere in between.

Mindsets 6.text: A lot of people I know in this university I'm quite familiar with their mindsets. Perhaps we should observe one doing their thing?

not {F}Mindsets.text: It looks like we're done talking about this topic!

Mindsets Frisbee 1.text: I recognize him! That's Kilograw. Top boomerang athlete of our university.

Mindsets Frisbee 1.1.text: Capable of throwing boomerangs as fast as the world's fastest baseball pitch.

Catch 1.text: [color=blue]You catch the boomerang with absolute confidence[/color]

Catch 1.1.text: [color=blue]You feel a cold yet strong breeze rush through your face.[/color]

Dodge 1.text: [color=blue]You and Pompom duck to avoid the boomerang.[/color]

Dodge 3.text: The boomerang passes by your side with the winds of what felt like jet engines!

Dodge 6.text: Hold on! The boomerang was at your head. I'm basically up to your knees! Why did I have to duck?

Sacrifice 1.1.text: [color=blue]Pompom's fur turns black. His eyes focus on the incoming boomerang.[/color]

Sacrifice 2.text: [color=blue]Pompom kicks the boomerang midair and turns towards you...[/color]

Save 2.text: [color=blue]You push Pompom out of the way! [/color]

Save 3.text: [color=blue]You take the full force of the boomerang. You get knocked on the grass.[/color]

Save 5.text: Wow you took that like a champ!

Growth Mindsets 1.text: Kilograw is a psychology major with sports career!

Growth Mindsets 2.text: And that amount of work and dedication is tough.

Growth Mindsets 3.text: Like really tough! You gotta have the guts y'hear?

Growth Mindsets 4.text: And said guts comes from the Growth Mindset itself.

Growth Mindsets 5.text: The [b]Growth Mindset[/b] is something Kilograw had to develop for himself.

Growth Mindsets 6.text: Individuals with [b]growth mindsets[/b] believe that they can improve at any task with effort and hard work

Growth Mindsets 7.text: The lack of effort is believed to be the reason why their performance in tasks get worse.

Growth Mindsets 8.text: "Failure" is just a word that means "I can do better".

Growth Mindsets 9.text: Kilograw had been practicing his boomerang throw every single day on that one spot.

Growth Mindsets 10.text: The grass that he practices on actually has his own footprints forever pressed into the dirt!

Growth Mindsets 11.text: He's the type to take whatever extra credit his professors gives to him because he seeks challenge and improvement.

Growth Mindsets 13.text: Not because he needed more things to fill his portfolio or his accomplishments. Although those things are nice to have overall.

Growth Mindsets 15.text: He does it for his own self improvement.

Growth Mindsets 16.text: My past conversations with him showed that he was not always the big strong guy you see right now.

choices.text: Don't you need to "fall" into the growth mindset?
choices.label: Growth Mindsets 17

Growth Mindsets 17.text: As you learn about Mindsets, you will think "Oh yeah! I think I have this mindset!".

Growth Mindsets 18.text: but there is a big possibility that your mindset may change...

Growth Mindsets 20.text: And so even gaining and maintaining a Growth Mindset will require your own efforts.

Growth Mindsets 21.text: Even the individuals who identify to the opposite mindset are also capable of improvement, but it must come from their own decisions

{F}Fixed_Mindset.text: And so individuals with Fixed Mindsets may also self-improve, but this needs to come from their decisions.

Growth Mindsets 22.text: And I believe in you and your potential to make it there one day. Like getting the good grades and such!

Growth Mindsets 23.text: Time for a survey, If I may!

Growth Mindsets 23.1.text: [i]I believe I will receive excellent grades in post-secondary[/i]

Growth Mindsets 24.text:
That covers the topic of the Growth Mindset. Let's go observe another student! 
(YOU RECEIVED THE GROWTH MINDSET KEYWORD!)

Mindsets Book 3.text: He doesn't say much but he is a reliable guy when you need some facts told.

Mindsets Book 4.text: He reads all kinds of books around campus! I wonder what he's reading now?

Mindsets Book 5.text: *You squint your eyes trying to identify the book*

choices.text: The book of the first Tiffany!?
choices.label: Tiffany 1

Riddles 1.text: [i]"Playing with people like fiddles. Riddles made for giggles."[/i]

Riddles 3.text: I remember some pretty fun riddles back in my day! Would you like to hear one?

Skip 2.text: You missed a pretty good one though!

Riddles Yes 1.text: An old friend from long ago taught me this one. I hope she's doing okay now.

Age 1.text: I'll explain it soon. But just know I am...

Riddles Yes 2.text: I view the world in little space, Am always changing place; No food I eat, but, by my power, Procure what millions do devour.

Riddle Wrong 1.text: I suppose it can be interpretted like that!

Riddle Correct 1.1.text:
+250 Wisdom 
 +1 Things to showoff to friends

Riddle Correct 2.text: Technically we are in a fictional virtual university but just roll with me here.

Jokes 2.text: Timothy has a hard time trying to talk to people.

Jokes 3.text: He must be reading that to help bring some humor into his attempts at socializing.

Jokes 4.text: It is quite the move but he just needs to be with the right people.

Jokes 5.text: Speaking of jokes! My old friend, Philogelos, taught me a good one, he wrote HUNDREDS of jokes...

Jokes 6.text: A coward is asked which are safer, warships or merchant-ships.

Tiffany 3.text: Someone from the internet is currently tracing the first recorded document of the name "Tiffany"

Tiffany 4.text: He went on and on, searching every historic archive he could get his hands on.With his most notable piece of evidence being a poem that goes like this...

Tiffany 4.1.text:
[i]William de Cognisby
Came out of Britany
With his wife Tiffany
And his maide Manfas
And his dog Hardigras.[/i]

Tiffany 5.text: He managed to trace it back to the year 324 but his search had yet to be concluded.

Tiffany 6.text: I was so into that video series and the only thing he needed...

Tiffany 7.text: ....is that book this random university student has...

Tiffany 8.text: I must get it off him later.

Tiffany 9.text: I must seek the knowledge of the first Tiffany...

Fixed Mindset 2.text: Timothy Putty currently has what is known as a [b]Fixed Mindset[/b]

Fixed Mindset 3.text: And I say "currently" because I know that he has been trying to improve lately.

Fixed Mindset 4.text: Individuals with the Fixed Mindset believe in the notion that one's abilities and talents are innate.

Fixed Mindset 5.text: That they are born with their skills, and those skills cant change

Fixed Mindset 7.text: "Failure" is often seen as a road block for people with Fixed Mindsets.

Fixed Mindset 8.text: They are also known to blame themselves when their approach to a task received poorly.

Fixed Mindset 12.text: A Fixed Mindset does not necessarily mean a 'Fixed' path for the individual

Fixed Mindset 13.text: Although I bet one with a fixed mindset may look at it that way.

Fixed Mindset 15.text: Perhaps we should observe another student about this?

Mindsets Rehearse 1.text: Oh my goats it's Kai Mera!

Mindsets Rehearse 3.text: This comes to no surprise but she is quite popular.

Mindsets Rehearse 4.text: And is a perfect example on how to develop one's growth mindset

Mindsets Rehearse 4.1.text: She has done a lot of interviews on the matter...

Mindsets Rehearse 5.1.text: Look at that practice performance she is doing!

No Rehearse.text: *Infatuated, Pompom did not just hear that.*

Drama 2.text: Just something about her performance tugs on your heartstrings

Drama 3.text: My favorite time with Kai was when I got a role with her in "Alice in Wonderland".

Drama 4.text: I got to be the caterpillar!

Drama 5.text: What? You thought I would be the cheshire cat?

choices.text: I thought you would be the chesire cat
choices.label: Thought 1

Thought 2.text: I got range. And really impressive for 1951! They even got my colors right in the costume.

Search 1.text: You should search up our performance of Alice in Wonderland back in 1951!

Search 2.text: The props were really impressive too for it's time. No way would I be able to make letters out of smoke like that.

Thought 3.text: Ah yes those were my stardom days. But not as popular as Kai!

Thought 4.text: Kai is incredible for still living that dream to this day.

Developing 2.text: I believe I have mentioned that Kai had several interviews in her past.

Developing 3.text: And in those interviews she is often asked questions on what are secrets to her success.

Developing 4.text: I've had my fair share of being able to attend and watch most of her interviews and I managed to boil it down to 4 main points.

Developing 5.text: Coincidentally, these four points are exactly what it takes to develop a growth mindset!

Developing 6.text: And that's because, similar to Kilograw, Kai also seeks self improvement.

Experiment 1.text: Tip number one would be to experiment

Experiment 2.text: Learning something new is not linear.

Experiment 3.text: In the case of Kai, acting was actually very challenging for her.

Experiment 4.text: She actually was a lot better at science than in the arts during middle school.But it was not exactly what she wanted by the end of her high school life.

Experiment 5.text: Her interest in acting came a lot later than most young actors and actresses and had decided to take a risk by signing up in the drama department of this university.

Experiment 6.text: Observing her during her student days as I walk the halls while trying to find the unviersity washrooms was like watching an action movie montage.

Experiment 7.text: She struggled very hard in alot of branches of theatre and especially acting.

Experiment 7.1.text: Add that to the fact that she,herself, has ADHD which adds on to the challenge of learning an entirely different discipline to her.

Experiment 8.text: But over time, she had approached her struggle with experimentation.

Experiment 9.text: She brought new ideas,processes, and strategy to her work. Eventually gradually improving her mindset over time.

Experiment 10.text: At some point, it was hardly a "waste of time" to her anymore.

Experiment 11.text: It was more of small steps that brought her closer to her goal.

Experiment 12.text: It was also a way of figuring out what does and does not work for her. And the same could be said to you!

Simple 1.text: Next up on the list is that "Simple" does not equate to easy

Simple 2.text: Simple ideas with challenging work might get a lot of people frustrated. Including you!

Simple 3.text: I once witnessed Kai get frustrated at the fact she couldn't get a hold of some acting and voice work methods despite it being quite easy for some other students from her class.

Simple 4.text: She may have even failed some assignments because she couldn't "get it"

Simple 5.text: But a conversation with her all those years ago had her thinking...

Simple 6.text: ...what someone needs to actually do is decide whether one to upgrade their approach in order to tackle the popular strategies effectively.

Past 1.text: With all this talk about strategies and experimentations, tip three is that "failure" is necessary.

Past 2.text: And with failure, feelings of frustration may also happen!

Past 3.text: But Time moves on and your past performances stay in the past.

Past 5.text: ...is entirely up to you! Past mistakes are now lessons to apply in the present.

Past 6.text: There is so much you can do to succeed!

Past 10.text: ...Addressing your challenges including ADHD and LD to make things easier...

Past 12.text: You've failed in the past. But you can always learn something new despite that.

Evaluate 2.text: Kai never would have improved if she never identified the struggle and challenges she has faced.

Evaluate 3.text: And self-evaulation is essential for figuring out the right and wrong strategies for herself.

Evaluate 4.text: The same must apply to you with this tour! You must ask yourself...

Evaluate 5.text: How is this strategy or tool helping me be productive?

Evaluate 6.text: What is challenging when using this tool? How may I address this challenge?

Evaluate 7.text: What could I do differently to make it more useful for me?

Evaluate 8.text: In what ways does this strategy or tool work, or not work, for me?

Evaluate 9.text: Curiosity about your approach is essential for improving your motivation and impoving your chances of success...

Evaluate 9.1.text: ...because if you are not succeeding with the approach you are using, you may not be using the right approach.

Evaluate 10.text:
This is how you develop your growth mindset.
(YOU HAVE OBTAINED THE DEVELOPING MINDSET KEYWORD +500)

Evaluate 12.text: [i]If I study in appropriate ways, then I will be able to learn the material in my courses.[/i]

Module 1.text: I am not your only guide in this post secondary preparation journey.

Module 2.text: I get tired too and sometimes you just need to get others to cover the rest of the content for you.

Module 3.text: So there are others to help you on this!

Module 4.text: There are 9 Modules in total and there are 4 representatives who will be teaching you for the rest of these modules.

Module 6.text: I will be back for some of these modules so don't miss me too much.

Module 7.text: Lets go over a few of the modules!

Module 9.text: [i]I expect to do well in post-secondary[/i]

Module 10.text: [i]I'm certain I can master the skills being taught in post-secondary[/i]

Module 11.text: [i]I'm confident I can understand the basic concepts taught in post-secondary[/i]

Module 13.text: Now let's introduce to you the different modules and their respective guides

Module 14.text: Are there any particular topics about post-secondary that interests you?

not {F}Mindsets.text: Any particular topics about post-secondary that interests you? I think you might find some of these faces familiar.

{F}Modules.text: Looks like we're all done on this topic!

choices.text: I got nothing else to ask!
choices.label: Something else

Fac 1.text: Everyone gets lost now and again.

Fac 2.text: Some people have things to do and they don't know where to do them on campus!

Fac 3.text: And that's what my purpose is!

Fac 4.text: I am still your tour guide and campus mascot. And I will be teaching you all about the various campus faculties.

Fac 5.text: One of my modules is the [b]Learning Strategies[/b] module.

Fac 6.text: Where I will be teaching you the common studying mistakes students make as well as the strategies that did work for them! Including stratagies specifically for people with ADHD and LD

Fac 7.text: I will also be giving you a tour of the various [b]Academic Supports and Accomodations[/b] facilities in another module.

Fac 8.text: Incoming students with ADHD and LD may find this particular module useful as I will be teaching students how to self-advocate.

Fac 9.text: Such as disclosing your disability to you institution, what your rights are as a student, and what accomodations you might want to have!

Fac 10.text: If you need to know where things are. I'm your cat. (YOU HAVE GAINED THE FACILITIES KEYWORD)

Student 1.text: Despite being a cat, I was a student once.

Student College 1.text: Nope! I actually attended this very virtual university!

Student College 2.text: Everyone here has been so nice when I had my undergrad here.

Student College 3.text: Unfortunately some people are allergic to cats so I had Kilograw stuff me in his sports bag for some lectures.

Student College 4.text: It smelled funky but the boomerangs made for great tables to write on!

Student Class 2.text: My favorite class has got to be...

Student Class 7.text: It really was my favorite class though. Good memories...

Life 2.text: And fun memories like that must be encouraged!

Life 3.text: But you can only do that if you are happy and healthy

Life 4.text: So you need to make the right choices and take care of yourself. Kilograw will assist with these types of things.

Life 6.text: Kilograw will cover the differences of post-secondary programs so that you may find the program that is best for you.

Life 8.text: Kilograw is a big self-care guy and he cares about you too!

Life 9.text: He personally volunteered to teach you some of the techniques that will keep your physical and mental well-being in check.

Life 10.text: He will also be showing your around the campus for some [b]Community and Belonging[/b] for module 8!

Life 11.text: A lonely post-secondary life is not so great.

Life 12.text: That's why Kilo here will show you where to find clubs and communities for you to meet new people in!

Life 12.1.text: I heard the hip lingo for this stuff is...

Life 12.2.text: [wave amp=100 freq=5]N e t w o r k i n g[/wave]

Life 13.text: Life is so much more than academics.(YOU OBTAINED THE STUDENT LIFE KEYWORD)

Prep 2.text: [i]I'm certain I can understand the most difficult material presented in the readings in post-secondary[/i]

Prep 4.text: Timothy Putty is a really reliable source for all things preparation.

Prep 5.text: He's a student just like you! So he is very aware of the culture shock you will eventually face when you enter post-secondary.

Prep 6.text: That's why he volunteered to do a module based on the [b]common differences between high school and post-secondary[/b]

Prep 7.text: He will also be giving you the rundown on [b]what to do before entering post secondary[/b]

Prep 9.text: He will even provide you a checklist and stuff for both during and before entering your semester!

Prep 11.text: I hope you get to learn alot from him! He is quite good at teaching and has potential to be professor one day.

Will.text:
Thank you!(YOU HAVE OBTAINED THE PREPARATIONS KEYWORD)
[color=green]+200 Motivated[/color]

Try.text:
I am rooting for both of you!(YOU HAVE OBTAINED THE PREPARATIONS KEYWORD)
[color=green]+200 Effort[/color]

Accom 1.text: A dear friend of mine named Kai Mera will be handling all things accomodations related.

not {F}Mindsets.text: Okay remember that actress friend of mine Kai? She's gonna be teaching you too on all stuff accomodations!

Accom 2.text: I'm actually very excited for you to meet her!

Accom 3.text: She's a professor here and so she knows lots of stuff.

Accom 5.text: Because she has ADHD herself and was actually a student in this university prior to becoming a professor.

not {F}Mindsets.text: I believe I told you before that she has ADHD herself which gives her a different progress in her classes than others.

Accom 6.text: She will teach you in [b]understanding your disability[/b] in greater detail.

Accom 7.text: This includes details about your disability itself,the stigma behind it,and the important of understanding your diagnosis

Accom 8.text: These will benefit you in understanding your disability and what it might mean for how you learn.

Accom 9.text: Along side this, she will also help you in your finances.

Accom 10.text: Through the [b]Scholarships and Financial Aid[/b] module.

Accom 11.text: Which should accomodate you financially, even teaching you how to get government loans for students with disabilities.

Accom 12.text: She might even bring a student or two with her to demonstrate how to use these accomodations accordingly.

Accom 13.text: I am SO excited for you to meet her. Oh my goats! She's like my best friend.

pompom 2.text: I know you want to talk about the talking cat...

pompom 3.text: ...but I never knew you would wanna do it during the tour!

choices.text: I like animals and I need answers
choices.label: pompom 4

choices.text: Perhaps I should talk about this another time
choices.label: Something else

Mention 3.text: I suppose that's just me feeling nostalgic...

pompom 6.text: I'm an immortal being born since the dawn of time...

pompom 8.text: ...left to wander the earth just to simply observe...

pompom 9.text: ...I don't even know where I came from.

pompom 10.text: As earth evolved, so did I.

pompom 14.text: Soon enough,some humans caught on to the fact that their "lifelong companion" took the title very seriously.

pompom 15.text: Back in the renaissance era, some guy shouted at a crowd...

pompom 16.text: "Thee shouldst see this cat with nineth lives!"

pompom 18.text: But I suppose that's where the saying came from.

{F}Lore.text:
That's all there is to know about me!
+500 LORE

{F}End_Up or {F}name.text: Anything else you want to talk about?

choices.text: How did you end up here?
choices.label: End up 1

choices.text: Why a tour guide now and not something more?
choices.label: More 1

End up 1.text: I took a lot of jobs throughout the ages.

End up 2.text: I served kings and common folk alike.

End up 3.text: But nothing had ever made me happier...

End up 5.text: So I became a tour guide come modern day!

End up 6.text: To help young folks like you find their way. And you don't have to be lost for it either. I just want to help folks!

End up 7.text: In this case, I am here to introduce you to post-secondary stuff and all the teachers and topics we will be covering here.

choices.text: I should probably get to knowing some of those.
choices.label: Module 1

End up 8.text: I did miss being the former librarian of this institution though...

End up 9.text: The books were pretty neat and I got to spend a fair time of my day reading the latest book of world records.

End up 10.text: Some insane feats of humanity are in display of that book!

End up 11.text: I,myself, can do some of the crazy stuff found in those books.

End up 12.text: Like having my skin be as tough as stone and can lay on a bed of nails with ease.

End up 13.text: Or having reflexes that can stop incoming air soft gun pellets with my own paws.

End up 14.text: Though these feats were not easy to do.

End up 15.text: I struggled as well trying to do these things.

End up 16.text: I actually ended bringing myself down to a bit of a [b]spiral[/b] situation.

End up 16.1.text: Where when I lose my motivation on the first sign of failure after multiple successes.

End up 16.2.text: It could even go another way! I could teach you more about it if you'd like!

{F}Loops.text: Loops are weird but they are a natural thing that happens to all people under a challenge

End up 17.text: I think I said too much about myself here. Maybe we can talk about this some other time?

choices.text: I suppose I should get back to the tour
choices.label: Something else

choices.text: Tell me more! Like your name!
choices.label: name 1

name 2.text: You want to learn about how I got my name

name 4.text: Psychopomps are beings that have the task of guiding lost souls.

name 5.text: And psychopomps are widespread across many cultures and I have participated in being a psychopomp for most of them.

name 6.text: You know, being immortal and all, you can apply to as many jobs as you want for as long as you want!

name 7.text: So I took the one I was pretty good at.

name 9.text: Though I was never referred to as "Pompom" since my birth.

name 10.text: It was given to me by a sweet little girl whom I played with in Ancient Egypt

name 11.text: I grew up by her side.

name 12.text: I became what is known as the "family" pet to those guys

name 13.text: At some point I learned how to talk.

name 14.text: I even got this neat little crown from her when she got older.

name 16.text: It took her a while to make it

name 17.text: Even to the point where she thought she could never do it.

name 18.text: That it's just not "in her" to "make things"

name 19.text: She has had this [b]mindset[/b] for a while until she had developed it, for the better ,with time.

name 20.text: This kind of thinking is actually similar to something I should be teaching you on this tour.

{F}Mindsets.text: Quite a familiar example of Fixed and Growth Mindset development wouldn't you agree?

choices.text: Yeah it is most certainly familar.
choices.label: name 20.1

choices.text: Show me more examples of Mindsets please
choices.label: Mindsets 1

name 20.1.text: She was also kind of funny about failing as well. Everytime she fails a single step at making that tiara she just takes a looongg break from it.

{F}Loops.text: She was more of a struggle spiral kinda gal as well. One missed step and she just "rests" for like a week or so.

choices.text: It's one natural response to things
choices.label: name 21

choices.text: Is this concept a part of the tour?
choices.label: Loops 1

More 1.text: I can serve gods and beings beyond your comprehension.

More 2.text: But the older I get the more I realize just how stressful it all is.

More 3.text: I may have one too many lives ahead of me. But work is work.

More 4.text: But I just want to settle...

More 5.text: I want to meet new people and make new connections.

More 6.text: Life is so beautiful here, mortal or immortal.

More 7.text: It's nice to keep growing and learn just by...being there y'know?

More 8.text: That's why I am more than happy to meet you student.

More 9.text: You're young and you're growing and trying to become something great!

More 10.text: And I can't wait to see what you students have in store to better humanity no matter what challenges you might face.

Thank you 2.text: We are done with the tour.

Thank you 4.text: It's been fun, but all good things come to an end to make room for even better things.

Thank you 5.text: Thank you for answering my questions earlier. They're meant to give you a better understanding of yourself based on several factors.

Thank you 6.text: In this tour, these questions were about your "Control of Learning Beliefs" and "Self-Efficacy for Learning and Performance". Tell me which one do you wanna see your assessment on.

{Q}Self_Efficacy >= 6.6.text: You expect to do well in post-secondary, and you feel that you will be able to master the content.

4.3 <= {Q}Self_Efficacy >= 6.5.text: You expect to do moderately well in post-secondary, /n and you feel that you may be able to master the content.

{Q}Self_Efficacy <= 4.2.text: You expect to do poorly in post-secondary.

{Q}Self_Efficacy >= 6.6.text: This is a great mindset to have!

4.3 <= {Q}Self_Efficacy >= 6.5.text: But you also expect to experience some setbacks.

{Q}Self_Efficacy <= 4.2.text: Which makes sense... post secondary can be hard.
But there are a lot of supports that you can use to increase your success!

{Q}Self_Efficacy >= 6.6.text: Sometimes, when people are very confident, setbacks can be more difficult to handle.

4.3 <= {Q}Self_Efficacy >= 6.5.text: You are confident in your abilities, but are also prepared for if something goes wrong.

{Q}Self_Efficacy <= 4.2.text: I hope that during your time on this virtual campus you will find strategies that work for you!

{Q}Self_Efficacy >= 6.6.text: Try to think about what you are going to do if you do not get a good grade. How are you going to react to a setback?

4.3 <= {Q}Self_Efficacy >= 6.5.text: So you will always be prepared, and be able to bounce back from a setback quicker!

{Q}Self_Efficacy <= 4.2.text: That way you can make the best out of post-secondary and feel confident your ability to succeed!

{Q}Control_Belief >= 6.7.text: You believe that working hard will lead to good results, which is great since this will apply in your school work too!

6.6 <= {Q}Control_Belief >= 4.8.text: You believe that hard work has a chance of leaving good results, the same chances can be said about your studies.

{Q}Control_Belief <= 4.7.text: According to your answers, you have a Fixed Mindset.

{Q}Control_Belief >= 6.7.text: Your hard work will lead to success. You most definitely have a [b]Growth Mindset[/b] from this.

6.6 <= {Q}Control_Belief >= 4.8.text: It is important to know that studying has been shown by science to lead to better grades.

{Q}Control_Belief <= 4.7.text: You believe that hard work does not pay off.

{Q}Control_Belief >= 6.7.text: Be careful though, all this hard work may leave you to burn out!

6.6 <= {Q}Control_Belief >= 4.8.text: You likely need to have your growth mindset develop.

{Q}Control_Belief <= 4.7.text: It is important to know that studying has been shown by science to lead to better grades.

Learning Beliefs 4.text: This means that people can improve themselves, and improve how they learn. It can be hard as a student with a disability, as you might find that it takes more time for you to do the same thing as your peers. But stick with it, as science tells us you will see better results.

{Q}Control_Belief >= 6.7.text: Take some time for some self-care to fix this.

6.6 <= {Q}Control_Belief >= 4.8.text: Perhaps revisiting the Mindsets portion of the tour in the directory could help.

{Q}Control_Belief <= 4.7.text: This means that people can improve themselves, and improve how they learn. It can be hard as a student with a disability, as you might find that it takes more time for you to do the same thing as your peers. But stick with it, as science tells us you will see better results.

{Q}Control_Belief >= 6.7.text: Module 7 with Kilograw is all about that stuff!

6.6 <= {Q}Control_Belief >= 4.8.text: Just head on over to the Main Menu and press "directory" to review the content.

{Q}Control_Belief <= 4.7.text: If you haven't seen results in the past, perhaps the studying strategies you employ may not be the best for you or your class, Module 5 is all about this and could help! As to improving your mindset, perhaps revisit the mindset portion of this tour in the directory.

Both 1.text: I hope these results helped you understand more about yourself.

Both 2.text: There is still much more to learn about post-secondary that I alone can't teach you!

Both 3.text: Which is why Kai will teach you module 1 at the Counseling Office not to far from here.

Both 4.text: We COULD magically get there by letting you go to the menu and have you move to the right then pressing spacebar.

Both 5.text: Buttt I think it's more fun to work for it!

Both 9.text: It's simple really. All you gotta do is chase me to the counseling office.

Both 10.text: Mind you I am quite fast.

Both 11.text: But that shouldn't be a problem. Remember those stars you have on you?

Both 12.text: Fun stuff happens when you have them. It just needs a wish. The wish gets stronger for every star you have.

Both 13.text: Just wish "I want to catch Pompom" and you're good to go!

Both 14.text: [color=blue]A surge of energy runs through you[/color]

Both 15.text: Sounds like you're good to go!

Both 16.text: I will also be questioning you about our tour material as we have our little game of tag

Both 17.text: Get them right or I'll have to stop to teach you some of it again. Oh! And watchout for people and stuffs you may bump into.

Both 18.text: You don't want an accident now and lose some star power. But I'm sure you got this!

Both 21.text:
[color=blue]Pompom runs like lighting leaving a gust of wind behind![/color]
See you laterrr!!
